item.title: The Last Train Out of Ada
item.description: They both watched as train 416 pulled away from the platform. And that was that â€” there would be no school in the morning. That was how it worked in rural Vekllei, a million miles from the automatic trains on endless timetables. Out here, you paced life around the station. There was not much to say about this, between the two of them. Tzipora looked at Cobian and pulled a froggy smile that tried to express that it was nobodyâ€™s fault.

item.title: The People of Veklleiâ€™s Railway (plus Dog)
item.description: Station Dogs # Iâ€™m starting a series looking at the lives and machines of domestic Vekllei life. Vekllei National Railways, or â€˜VK Railâ€™ was the bastard of six major pre-war rail companies that were extinguished along with the society that housed them. Today there are three rail companies in Vekllei, but all of them operate under direct supervision of a Vekllei Industry Bureau ( making it Venrouiva, in other words) and are only broken up for reasons of logistics.
